com.welie.blessed

Class BluetoothPeripheral

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.welie.blessed.BluetoothPeripheral

  • public class BluetoothPeripheral
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a remote Bluetooth peripheral and replaces BluetoothDevice and BluetoothGatt

    A BluetoothPeripheral lets you create a connection with the peripheral or query information about it. This class is a wrapper around the BluetoothDevice and takes care of operation queueing, some Android bugs, and provides several convenience functions.

    • Field Summary

    • Method Detail

      • createBond

        public boolean createBond()
        Create a bond with the peripheral.

        If a (auto)connect has been issued, the bonding command will be enqueued and you will receive updates via the BluetoothPeripheralCallback. Otherwise the bonding will be done immediately and no updates via the callback will happen.

        Returns:
        true if bonding was started/enqueued, false if not

      • cancelConnection

        public void cancelConnection()
        Cancel an active or pending connection.

        This operation is asynchronous and you will receive a callback on onDisconnectedPeripheral.

      • getServices

        @NotNull
public @NotNull java.util.List<android.bluetooth.BluetoothGattService> getServices()
        Get the services supported by the connected bluetooth peripheral. Only services that are also supported by BluetoothCentralManager are included.
        Returns:
        Supported services.

      • getMaximumWriteValueLength

        public int getMaximumWriteValueLength(WriteType writeType)
        Get maximum length of byte array that can be written depending on WriteType

        This value is derived from the current negotiated MTU or the maximum characteristic length (512)

      • isNotifying

        public boolean isNotifying(@NotNull
                           @NotNull android.bluetooth.BluetoothGattCharacteristic characteristic)
        Boolean to indicate if the specified characteristic is currently notifying or indicating.
        Parameters:
        characteristic - the characteristic to check
        Returns:
        true if the characteristic is notifying or indicating, false if it is not

      • readCharacteristic

        public boolean readCharacteristic(@NotNull
                                  @NotNull java.util.UUID serviceUUID,
                                  @NotNull
                                  @NotNull java.util.UUID characteristicUUID)
        Read the value of a characteristic.

        The characteristic must support reading it, otherwise the operation will not be enqueued.

        Parameters:
        serviceUUID - the service UUID the characteristic belongs to
        characteristicUUID - the characteristic's UUID
        Returns:
        true if the operation was enqueued, false if the characteristic does not support reading or the characteristic was not found

      • readCharacteristic

        public boolean readCharacteristic(@NotNull
                                  @NotNull android.bluetooth.BluetoothGattCharacteristic characteristic)
        Read the value of a characteristic.

        The characteristic must support reading it, otherwise the operation will not be enqueued.

        BluetoothPeripheralCallback.onCharacteristicUpdate(BluetoothPeripheral, byte[], BluetoothGattCharacteristic, GattStatus) will be triggered as a result of this call.

        Parameters:
        characteristic - Specifies the characteristic to read.
        Returns:
        true if the operation was enqueued, false if the characteristic does not support reading or the characteristic was invalid

      • writeCharacteristic

        public boolean writeCharacteristic(@NotNull
                                   @NotNull java.util.UUID serviceUUID,
                                   @NotNull
                                   @NotNull java.util.UUID characteristicUUID,
                                   @NotNull
                                   @NotNull byte[] value,
                                   @NotNull
                                   @NotNull WriteType writeType)
        Write a value to a characteristic using the specified write type.

        All parameters must have a valid value in order for the operation to be enqueued. If the characteristic does not support writing with the specified writeType, the operation will not be enqueued.

        Parameters:
        serviceUUID - the service UUID the characteristic belongs to
        characteristicUUID - the characteristic's UUID
        value - the byte array to write
        writeType - the write type to use when writing. Must be WRITE_TYPE_DEFAULT, WRITE_TYPE_NO_RESPONSE or WRITE_TYPE_SIGNED
        Returns:
        true if the operation was enqueued, false if the characteristic does not support reading or the characteristic was not found

      • writeCharacteristic

        public boolean writeCharacteristic(@NotNull
                                   @NotNull android.bluetooth.BluetoothGattCharacteristic characteristic,
                                   @NotNull
                                   @NotNull byte[] value,
                                   @NotNull
                                   @NotNull WriteType writeType)
        Write a value to a characteristic using the specified write type.

        All parameters must have a valid value in order for the operation to be enqueued. If the characteristic does not support writing with the specified writeType, the operation will not be enqueued. The length of the byte array to write must be between 1 and getMaximumWriteValueLength(writeType).

        BluetoothPeripheralCallback.onCharacteristicWrite(BluetoothPeripheral, byte[], BluetoothGattCharacteristic, GattStatus) will be triggered as a result of this call.

        Parameters:
        characteristic - the characteristic to write to
        value - the byte array to write
        writeType - the write type to use when writing.
        Returns:
        true if a write operation was succesfully enqueued, otherwise false

      • readDescriptor

        public boolean readDescriptor(@NotNull
                              @NotNull android.bluetooth.BluetoothGattDescriptor descriptor)
        Read the value of a descriptor.
        Parameters:
        descriptor - the descriptor to read
        Returns:
        true if a write operation was succesfully enqueued, otherwise false

      • writeDescriptor

        public boolean writeDescriptor(@NotNull
                               @NotNull android.bluetooth.BluetoothGattDescriptor descriptor,
                               @NotNull
                               @NotNull byte[] value)
        Write a value to a descriptor.

        For turning on/off notifications use setNotify(BluetoothGattCharacteristic, boolean) instead.

        Parameters:
        descriptor - the descriptor to write to
        value - the value to write
        Returns:
        true if a write operation was succesfully enqueued, otherwise false

      • setNotify

        public boolean setNotify(@NotNull
                         @NotNull java.util.UUID serviceUUID,
                         @NotNull
                         @NotNull java.util.UUID characteristicUUID,
                         boolean enable)
        Set the notification state of a characteristic to 'on' or 'off'. The characteristic must support notifications or indications.
        Parameters:
        serviceUUID - the service UUID the characteristic belongs to
        characteristicUUID - the characteristic's UUID
        enable - true for setting notification on, false for turning it off
        Returns:
        true if the operation was enqueued, false the characteristic could not be found or does not support notifications

      • setNotify

        public boolean setNotify(@NotNull
                         @NotNull android.bluetooth.BluetoothGattCharacteristic characteristic,
                         boolean enable)
        Set the notification state of a characteristic to 'on' or 'off'. The characteristic must support notifications or indications.

        BluetoothPeripheralCallback.onNotificationStateUpdate(BluetoothPeripheral, BluetoothGattCharacteristic, GattStatus) will be triggered as a result of this call.

        Parameters:
        characteristic - the characteristic to turn notification on/off for
        enable - true for setting notification on, false for turning it off
        Returns:
        true if the operation was enqueued, false if the characteristic doesn't support notification or indications or

      • readRemoteRssi

        public boolean readRemoteRssi()
        Read the RSSI for a connected remote peripheral.

        BluetoothPeripheralCallback.onReadRemoteRssi(BluetoothPeripheral, int, GattStatus) will be triggered as a result of this call.

        Returns:
        true if the operation was enqueued, false otherwise

      • requestMtu

        public boolean requestMtu(int mtu)
        Request an MTU size used for a given connection.

        When performing a write request operation (write without response), the data sent is truncated to the MTU size. This function may be used to request a larger MTU size to be able to send more data at once.

        BluetoothPeripheralCallback.onMtuChanged(BluetoothPeripheral, int, GattStatus) will be triggered as a result of this call.

        Parameters:
        mtu - the desired MTU size
        Returns:
        true if the operation was enqueued, false otherwise

      • requestConnectionPriority

        public boolean requestConnectionPriority(@NotNull
                                         @NotNull ConnectionPriority priority)
        Request a different connection priority.
        Parameters:
        priority - the requested connection priority
        Returns:
        true if request was enqueued, false if not

      • setPreferredPhy

        public boolean setPreferredPhy(PhyType txPhy,
                               PhyType rxPhy,
                               PhyOptions phyOptions)
        Set the preferred connection PHY for this app. Please note that this is just a recommendation, whether the PHY change will happen depends on other applications preferences, local and remote controller capabilities. Controller can override these settings.

        BluetoothPeripheralCallback.onPhyUpdate(com.welie.blessed.PhyType, com.welie.blessed.PhyType, com.welie.blessed.GattStatus) will be triggered as a result of this call, even if no PHY change happens. It is also triggered when remote device updates the PHY.

        Parameters:
        txPhy - the desired TX PHY
        rxPhy - the desired RX PHY
        phyOptions - the desired optional sub-type for PHY_LE_CODED
        Returns:
        true if request was enqueued, false if not

      • readPhy

        public boolean readPhy()
        Read the current transmitter PHY and receiver PHY of the connection. The values are returned in BluetoothPeripheralCallback.onPhyUpdate(com.welie.blessed.PhyType, com.welie.blessed.PhyType, com.welie.blessed.GattStatus)

      • clearServicesCache

        public boolean clearServicesCache()
        Asynchronous method to clear the services cache. Make sure to add a delay when using this!
        Returns:
        true if the method was executed, false if not executed
